intro: Fuirena brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian fireweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and has slender, erect stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers are arranged in spikes. Fuirena brasiliensis is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and stabilizing wetland soils.
